008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.util.parameters;
010
011import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
012import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
013import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
014import java.lang.annotation.Target;
015import java.lang.reflect.Field;
016import java.lang.reflect.Modifier;
017
018import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
019
020/**
021 * <p>
022 * This interface adds functionality to {@link ParameterBundle} to
023 * interact with ImageJ's {@link GenericDialog}.
024 * Current features include: 
025 * <br>
026 * (a) Makes parameter bundles printable by listing all
027 * eligible fields.
028 * <br>
029 * (b) Parameter bundles can be added/modified as a whole by ImageJ's
030 * {@link GenericDialog}, supported by specific annotations (use methods
031 * {@link #addToDialog(GenericDialog)} and
032 * {@link #getFromDialog(GenericDialog)}).
033 * </p>
034 * <p>
035 * See the example in {@code DemoParameters} below. Other functionality may be
036 * added in the future.
037 * </p>
038 * <pre>
039 * // Sample parameter bundle:
040 * 
041 * enum MyEnum { A, B, Cee };
042 * 
043 * static class DemoParameters implements DialogParameterBundle {
044 *      public static int staticInt = 44; // currently static members are listed too!
045 * 
046 *      &#64;DialogLabel("Make a decision:")
047 *      public boolean someBool = true;
048 *      public int someInt = 39;
049 *      public float someFloat = 1.99f;
050 * 
051 *      &#64;DialogLabel("Math.PI")
052 *      &#64;DialogDigits(10)
053 *      public double someDouble = Math.PI;
054 *      public String someString = "SHOW ME";
055 * 
056 *      &#64;DialogHide
057 *      public String hiddenString = "HIDE ME";
058 *      public MyEnum someEnum = MyEnum.B;
059 * }
060 * 
061 * public static void main(String[] args) {
062 *      DialogParameterBundle params = new DemoParameters();
063 *      System.out.println("p1 = \n" + params.printToString());
064 * 
065 *      GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(ParameterBundle.class.getSimpleName());
066 *      gd.addNumericField("some single int", 123, 0);
067 *      params.addToDialog(gd);
068 * 
069 *      gd.showDialog();
070 *      if (gd.wasCanceled())
071 *              return;
072 * 
073 *      int singleInt = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
074 *      boolean success = params.getFromDialog(gd);
075 *      System.out.println("success = " + success);
076 *      System.out.println("p2 = \n" + params.printToString());
077 * }
078 * </pre>
079 * 
080 * @author WB
081 * @version 2022/02/02
082 * @version 2022/09/13 split from {@link ParameterBundle}
083 * 
084 * @see DialogDigits
085 * @see DialogLabel
086 * @see DialogHide
087 */
088public interface DialogParameterBundle extends ParameterBundle {
089        
090        // ---- Dialog-related annotations to be used on individual parameter fields ------
091                
092        /**
093         * Annotation to specify a specific 'label' (value) to be shown for following
094         * parameter fields. Default label is the variable name.
095         */
096        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
097        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
098        public @interface DialogLabel {
099                public String value();
100        }
101        
102        /**
103         * Annotation to specify the number of digits (value) displayed when showing
104         * numeric values in dialogs.
105         * This annotation has no effect on non-floating-point fields.
106         */
107        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
108        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
109        public @interface DialogDigits {
110                public int value();
111        }
112        
113        /**
114         * Annotation to hide the following parameter field in dialogs.
115         */
116        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
117        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
118        public @interface DialogHide {
119        }
120        
121        // ------------ ImageJ dialog-related (TODO: move to another interface?) ------------------
122        
123        /**
124         * Adds all qualified fields of this {@link DialogParameterBundle} to the specified
125         * {@link GenericDialog} instance, in the order of their definition.
126         * Qualified means that the field is of suitable type and no 
127         * {@link DialogHide} annotation is present.
128         * 
129         * @param gd a generic dialog
130         */
131        public default void addToDialog(GenericDialog gd) {
132                Class<? extends DialogParameterBundle> clazz = this.getClass();
133                Field[] fields = clazz.getFields();             // gets only public fields
134                for (Field f : fields) {
135                        if (!isValidParameterItem(f) || f.isAnnotationPresent(DialogHide.class)) {
136                                continue;
137                        }
138                        try {
139                                addFieldToDialog(f, gd);
140                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) {
141                                throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());     // TODO: refine exception handling!
142                        }
143                }
144        }
145        
146        /**
147         * Retrieves and sets all fields of this {@link DialogParameterBundle}
148         * by reading the associated values from the specified {@link GenericDialog} instance.
149         * Throws an exception if anything goes wrong.
150         * 
151         * @param gd a {@link GenericDialog} instance
152         * @return true if all fields were successfully read
153         */
154        public default boolean getFromDialog(GenericDialog gd) {
155                Class<? extends DialogParameterBundle> clazz = this.getClass();
156                Field[] fields = clazz.getFields();             // gets only public fields
157                int errorCount = 0;
158                for (Field f : fields) {
159                        if (!isValidParameterItem(f) || f.isAnnotationPresent(DialogHide.class)) {
160                                continue;
161                        }
162                        try {
163                                if (!getFieldFromDialog(f, gd)) {
164                                        errorCount++;
165                                }
166                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) { 
167                                throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage()); // TODO: refine exception handling!
168                        }
169                }
170                return (errorCount == 0);
171        }
172        
173        /**
174         * Checks if the specified parameter field is of a valid type
175         * to be added to a {@link GenericDialog}.
176         * The only permissible types are {@code boolean}, {@code int},
177         * {@code float}, {@code double}, {@link String}, and {@code enum}.
178         * @param f
179         * @return
180         */
181        static boolean isValidParameterItem(Field f) {
182                int mod = f.getModifiers();
183                if (Modifier.isPrivate(mod) || Modifier.isFinal(mod) || Modifier.isStatic(mod)) {
184                        return false;
185                }
186                Class<?> clazz = f.getType();
187                if (clazz == boolean.class || clazz == int.class || clazz == float.class || clazz == double.class || 
188                        clazz == String.class || clazz.isEnum())
189                        return true;
190                else
191                        return false;
192        }
193
194        
195        /**
196         * Adds the specified {@link Field} of this object as new item to 
197         * the {@link GenericDialog} instance.
198         * The name of the field is used as the 'label' of the dialog item.
199         * TODO: this method should not be public (possible in Java9)!
200         * 
201         * @param field some field
202         * @param dialog the dialog
203         * @throws IllegalAccessException when field is accessed illegally
204         */
205        default void addFieldToDialog(Field field, GenericDialog dialog)
206                        throws IllegalAccessException {
207                
208                String name = field.getName();
209                if (field.isAnnotationPresent(DialogLabel.class)) {
210                        name = field.getAnnotation(DialogLabel.class).value();
211                }
212                
213                int digits = 2; // DefaultDialogDigits;
214                if (field.isAnnotationPresent(DialogDigits.class)) {
215                        digits = field.getAnnotation(DialogDigits.class).value();
216                        digits = Math.max(0,  digits);
217                }
218                
219                Class<?> clazz = field.getType();
220                if  (clazz.equals(boolean.class)) {
221                        dialog.addCheckbox(name, field.getBoolean(this));
222                }
223                else if (clazz.equals(int.class)) {
224                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getInt(this), 0);
225                }
226                else if (clazz.equals(float.class)) {
227                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getFloat(this), digits);
228                }
229                else if (clazz.equals(double.class)) {
230                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getDouble(this), digits);
231                }
232                else if (clazz.equals(String.class)) {
233                        String str = (String) field.get(this);
234                        dialog.addStringField(name, str);
235                }
236                else if (clazz.isEnum()) {
237                        dialog.addEnumChoice(name, (Enum<?>) field.get(this));
238                }
239                else {
240                        // ignore this field
241                        //throw new RuntimeException("cannot handle field of type " + clazz);
242                }
243        }
244
245        /**
246         * Modifies the specified {@link Field} of this object by reading the next item
247         * from the {@link GenericDialog} instance.
248         * TODO: this method should be private (possible in Java9)!
249         * 
250         * @param field a publicly accessible {@link Field} of this object 
251         * @param gd a {@link GenericDialog} instance
252         * @return true if successful
253         * @throws IllegalAccessException illegal field access
254         */
255        @SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
256        default boolean getFieldFromDialog(Field field, GenericDialog gd)
257                                        throws IllegalAccessException {
258                Class<?> clazz = field.getType();
259                if  (clazz.equals(boolean.class)) {
260                        field.setBoolean(this, gd.getNextBoolean());
261                }
262                else if (clazz.equals(int.class)) {
263                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
264                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
265                                return false;
266                        }
267                        field.setInt(this, (int) val);
268                }
269                else if (clazz.equals(float.class)) {
270                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
271                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
272                                return false;
273                        }
274                        field.setFloat(this, (float) val);
275                }
276                else if (clazz.equals(double.class)) {
277                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
278                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
279                                return false;
280                        }
281                        field.setDouble(this, val);
282                }
283                else if (clazz.equals(String.class)) {
284                        String str = gd.getNextString();
285                        if (str == null) {
286                                return false;
287                        }
288                        field.set(this, str);
289                }
290                else if (clazz.isEnum()) {
291                        Enum en = gd.getNextEnumChoice((Class<Enum>) clazz);
292                        if (en == null) {
293                                return false;
294                        }
295                        field.set(this, en);
296//                      field.set(instance, gd.getNextEnumChoice((Class<? extends Enum>) clazz));       // works                        
297//                      field.set(instance, gd.getNextEnumChoice((Class<Enum>) clazz)); // works        
298                }
299                else {
300                        // ignore this field
301                        // throw new RuntimeException("cannot handle field of type " + clazz);
302                }
303                return true;
304        }
305
306}
